title: Getting Rid of Fraction Denominators
text: What is the LCD (largest common denominator) of this equation?

title: Getting Rid of Fraction Denominators
text: Now, we must multiply by the LCD on both sides of the equation. We now have $$(5x-3)=2x$$.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: To solve this equation, we must first isolate the "x" term.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: We can isolate the "x" term by subtracting $$2x$$ from both sides of the equatoin. We now have $$3x-3=0$$.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: Now, we must add $$3$$ to both sides of the equation. We now have $$3x=3$$.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: Finally, we can divide both sides of the equation by $$3$$. What is the solution of the equation?
